title: What Five Years of Ranking the Best-Managed Companies Reveals
sub_head: What do the companies with the strongest stocks have in common?
body:
This is the fifth year the Drucker Institute and The Wall Street Journal have compiled the Management Top 250 rankings. With five years of data, we took the opportunity to look back and analyze the performance over time of all the companies eligible for the Top 250.
First we looked at the constellation of this year’s Top 250-eligible companies as a whole to see how each one’s effectiveness score relates to the consistency of its scores in the five components of the overall ranking: customer satisfaction, employee engagement and development, innovation, social responsibility and financial strength.
